question: Bruno wants to buy two and one-half dozens of pens. How many pens will he have?
ground_truth:
Since a dozen is equal to 12, then two dozens are equal to 12 x 2= 24.
One-half dozen is equal to 12/2 = 6.
Thus, Bruno will have a total of 24 + 6 = 30 pens.
 30
student_incorrect_solution:
One dozen is equal to 12, so two dozens is equal to 2 x 12 = 24 pens.
Half of a dozen is equal to 6, so half of 12 is equal to 6 and half of a dozen is equal to 6.
Therefore, one and a half dozen is equal to 1 x 12 + 6 = 18 pens.
Thus, two and one-half dozens of pens is equal to 24 + 18 = 42 pens.
 42

question: A local restaurant is offering an 8 piece fried chicken bucket and 2 sides for $12.00 that will feed 6 people.  If Monty was having a family reunion for 36 family members, how much will it cost him to buy enough chicken and sides to feed everyone one serving?
ground_truth: Monty needs to feed 36 family members and each chicken/meal combo feeds 6 people so he needs 36/6 = 6 combos\nEach chicken/meal combo costs $12.00 and he needs 6 so it will cost him 12*6 = $72.00 to feed everyone\n 72
student_incorrect_solution:
If the 8 piece fried chicken bucket and 2 sides feed 6 people, then each serving feeds 6/8 = 0.75 people.
To feed 36 people, Monty will need 36/0.75 = 48 servings.
To buy 48 servings, Monty will need to buy 48/6 = 8 sets of the chicken bucket and sides.
The cost of buying 8 sets of the chicken bucket and sides will be 8 x $12 = $96.
 96
